title: Nigerian students amass degrees to stay in Europe
description: Modupe Osunkoya enrolled on her third post-graduate degree because she says there are no jobs at home.

title: Can apps move the #MeToo movement forward?
description: Reporting sexual harassment at work is getting easier thanks to new technologies.

title: Women risking fines for feminism
description: A movement that started in Paris, has now spread into locations across the globe.

title: Para-athlete takes tornado kicks to Tokyo
description: For the first time, the Paralympic games will host a Para-Taekwondo competition.

title: Afghanistan: Fleeing the Taliban into Pakistan and leaving dreams behind
description: The BBC speaks to Afghans fleeing the Taliban into Pakistan at the Chaman Spin Boldak border.

title: Rugby study finds brain affected in one season
description: One season of professional rugby could be enough to see a decline in a player's blood flow to the brain and cognitive function, a new study claims.

title: The remarkable rise of the independent councillors
description: A quiet revolution is taking place in England and Wales as independent councillors challenge big parties.

title: From Bush to Biden: One war, four US presidents on Afghanistan
description: Two decades of conflict in Afghanistan shaped the legacies of each of these commanders-in-chief.

title: Gunfire as Taliban celebrate US leaving Afghanistan
description: Gunfire rang out as the BBC's Lyse Doucet reported on US troops' departure from Kabul.

title: Taliban are back - what next for Afghanistan?
description: As the Taliban take power after 20 years of conflict, what did the war achieve and what happens now?

title: Hurricane Ida: Striking pictures show storm sweeping Gulf Coast
description: Hurricane Ida made landfall on the US state of Louisiana, on the 16th anniversary of Hurricane Katrina.

title: Afghan left behind by UK: I'm fighting to stay alive
description: An Afghan who had authorisation to fly to the UK speaks to the BBC about his struggle to escape.

title: Tokyo Paralympics: Ellie Robinson's 'story of triumph not defeat'
description: Ellie Robinson says her fifth-place finish in the S6 butterfly final at the Tokyo Paralympics was "a story of triumph not defeat".

title: Afghanistan: US investigating civilian deaths in Kabul strike
description: The strike aimed to stop a suicide bomber, but killed six children and four adults from one family.

title: Peacock claims joint bronze in Paralympic T64 100m
description: Jonnie Peacock wins joint bronze in the T64 100m as he misses out on a third consecutive Paralympic sprint title in Tokyo.

title: Bank robbers in Brazil tie hostages to getaway cars
description: Armed gang members took hostages as human shields, after a bank robbery in Brazil.

title: Milan fire: Flames engulf modern 20-storey block of flats
description: The tower is only 10 years old and questions are being asked about how the fire spread so dramatically.

title: Kanye West: Donda released by Universal without my say, artist claims
description: The rapper says his record label released his delayed 10th album without his permission.

title: Tokyo Paralympics: Andrew Small and Phoebe Paterson Pine claims golds as GB win eight medals
description: Andrew Small wins his first Paralympic title in the T33 100m, Phoebe Paterson Pine takes archery gold on her Games debut and Natasha Baker wins silver in equestrian freestyle on day six of Tokyo 2020.

title: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon tests negative for Covid-19
description: The first minister had been self-isolating after being identified as a close contact of a Covid case.

title: Uruguay cancel call-up for Man Utd's Cavani
description: Edinson Cavani will remain with Manchester United over the international break after his call-up to the Uruguay squad was cancelled.

title: Afghanistan: UK sceptical of Taliban safe passage pledge, says minister
description: The government is seeking international support to ensure the militants allow people to leave Afghanistan.

title: Paralympics: Tokyo gold 'sweetest of all' for sprinter Smyth
description: Jason Smyth says he crossed the line unsure if he had added to his record breaking gold medal haul.

title: 'Why Kane deserved move & how Spurs have bounced back from turbulent summer' - Jermaine Jenas
description: MOTD2 pundit Jermaine Jenas says Harry Kane deserved a move away from Tottenham and looks at how the club has bounced back after a difficult summer.

title: Ed Asner: Lou Grant and Up actor dies aged 91
description: He'll be remembered for his roles as TV newsman Lou Grant and the lead voice role in Pixar hit Up.

title: YouTuber Paul beats ex-UFC champion Woodley by split decision in boxing bout
description: Jake Paul goes the distance for the first time in his fledgling boxing career with a split decision victory over Tyron Woodley on a glitzy night in Cleveland.

title: Paramotor pilot shares pictures of John O'Groats-Land's End flight
description: Daniel Jones snaps aerial images from John O'Groats to Land's End while on a very personal mission.

title: Affordable uniforms law will miss new school year
description: Parents are concerned that a law to make school uniforms cheaper will not be in place for September.

title: The summer day a police chief was shot in seaside town
description: Ian Hampson recalls one of Lancashire Police's darkest days, when he and two other officers were shot.

title: Hurricane Ida: New Orleans loses power as storm strikes
description: Forecasters say the storm, which is battering Louisiana with 150mph winds, is extremely dangerous.

title: The Papers: Afghans could fight for UK and British troops home
description: The continuing fallout from the evacuation of Afghanistan features on most front pages on Monday.

title: Covid travel: Latest changes begin as seven countries go green
description: People arriving from Canada and Denmark are among those who will not need to isolate for 10 days.

title: Ethiopia's economy battered by Tigray war
description: Food prices are rising, the currency's value is falling and investor confidence is shaken.
